Authors:
Yalemwork Meswaet, Ralph Mangelsdorff, Nourou S Yorou,
Meike Piepenbring
Title:
Unraveling unexplored diversity of cercosporoid fungi
(Mycosphaerellaceae, Capnodiales, Ascomycota) in tropical Africa
Keywords:
Benin, Cercospora, Fabaceae, Leguminosae, molecular
phylogenetic analyses¬¬, Passalora, Pseudocercospora, West Africa
Abstract:
Cercosporoid fungi (Mycosphaerellaceae, Capnodiales,
Ascomycota) are one of the largest and most diverse groups of
hyphomycetes causing a wide range of diseases of economically important
plants as well as of plants in the wild. Although more than 6000 species
are known for this group, the documentation of this fungal group is far
from being complete. Especially in the tropics, the diversity of
cercosporoid fungi is poorly known. The present study aims to report and
characterize cercosporoid fungi collected on host plants belonging to
Fabaceae in Benin, West Africa. Information on their morphology, host
species and DNA sequence data (18S rDNA, 28S rDNA, ITS and tef1) is
provided. DNA sequence data were obtained by a simple and
non-culture-based method for DNA isolation which has been applied for
cercosporoid fungi for the first time in the context of the present
study. Among the loci used for the phylogenetic analysis, tef1 provided
the best resolution together with the multigene dataset. Species
delimitation in many cases, however, was only possible by combining
molecular sequence data with morphological characteristics. Based on
thirty-nine specimens recently collected in Benin, eighteen species are
presented with morphological descriptions, illustrations and sequence
data. Among these, six species in the genus Cercospora and two species
in Pseudocercospora are proposed as species new to science. The newly
described species are C. beninensis on Crotalaria sp., C. parakouensis
on Desmodium tortuosum, C. rhynchophorae on Vigna unguiculata, C.
vignae-subterraneae on Vigna subterraneanea, C. tentaculifera on Vigna
unguiculata, C. zorniicola on Zornia glochidiata, Ps. sennicola on Senna
occidentalis and Ps. tabei on V. unguiculata. Eight species of
cercosporoid fungi are reported for Benin for the first time, four of
them namely, Cercospora cf. canscorina, C. cf. fagopyri, C.
phaseoli-lunati and Cercospora sp. YMM297B are new for West Africa. Two
species of cercosporoid fungi were previously reported from Benin and
are confirmed.
